text: The Macau Football Association (; ) is the governing body of association football in Macau, China. ==History== On 27 June 2019, the FIFA Disciplinary Committee sanctioned the Macau Football Association for failing to play the second leg of their first-round match against Sri Lanka in the AFC’s 2022 FIFA World Cup preliminary competition, due to be played on 11 June 2019. FIFA declared a 3-0 forfeit victory for Sri Lanka, with the Macau Football Association also receiving a fine of CHF 10,000. ==Association staff== {|class="wikitable hlist" style="text-align:left" !Name !Position !Source |- | Cheung Vitor Lup Kwan |President | |- | Chong Coc Veng |Vice President | |- | Lai Pak Leng |2nd Vice President | |- | Chan Keng Hou |General Secretary | |- | Benjamin Chio |Treasurer | |- |Zhang Hong |Technical Director | |- | Iong Cho Ieng |Team Coach (Men's) | |- |Zhang Hong |Team Coach (Women's) | |- |n/a |Media/Communications Manager | |- | Lau Weng Hang |Futsal Coordinator | |- | Lau Peng Wai |Referee Coordinator | |- |} ==See also== * Sport in Macau ==References== ==External links== * Official website * Macau at the FIFA website. * Macau at AFC site Category:Football in Macau Macau Category:Sports organizations established in 1939 Category:1939 establishments in Macau
title: Macau Football Association
